Class Flag

  • java.lang.Object
    • Flag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Carryable

    public class Flag
extends java.lang.Object
implements Carryable
    the flag that players carry to their base (from their opponent's) to win
    Author:
    hdesouza538

      • Flag

        public Flag(processing.core.PImage p,
            Player home,
            Player enemy,
            double x,
            double y)
        initializes Flag object by initializing variables home, enemy, x, y, initalx, initialy
        Parameters:
        home - the player whose flag it is
        enemy - the enemy of the player whose flag it is
        x - the x value the flag is created at
        y - the y value the flag is created at

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(DrawingSurface drawer,
                 processing.core.PImage img,
                 double x,
                 double y)
        draws the flag to the screen
        Parameters:
        drawer - the DrawingSurface that the flag will be drawn onto
        img - the PImage that will be drawn
        x - the x-coord of the flag (where it will be drawn)
        y - the y-coord of the flag (where it will be drawn)

      • pickUp

        public boolean pickUp(Player p)
        checks whether the player trying to pick the flag up can (if it is already held or not) and changes the possession of the flag
        Specified by:
        pickUp in interface Carryable
        Parameters:
        p - the player trying to pick up the flag
        Returns:
        true if the flag is picked up and is not already held by the enemy, false otherwise
